JobFullDesc: Product Analytics ConsultantAre you driven by curiosity, moving forward, and opening new doors that lead down new paths? Are you always thinking about the next innovative product to bring to life?Dell's Experience Innovation Group is seeking talented designers, technologists, and strategists to collaborate and develop amazing experiences for our customers. We're looking for individuals who are passionate about working in an agile, diverse, global team, who can reimagine tomorrow and deliver solutions that solve real problems.As a team, we live to take risks, push boundaries, and stretch beyond the comfort zone – with a vision to create technologies that drive human progress.Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound impact as a Product Analytics Consultant!What you’ll achieveAs a Product Analytics Consultant you will help establish the vision and strategy to define, build and manage data, analytics, and insights capabilities within and across Dell’s new cloud products and services.You will:Establish foundational data collection, analytics, and customer experience monitoring capabilities and develop methodologies and reports for analyzing and presenting data.Research, evaluate, and recommend new analytics tools and data capture methodologies.Define new KPI’s and monitor and measure the product performance effectiveness. Lead cross functional measurement teams from Marketing and IT to deliver reporting and dashboards.Partner with product management, engineering and analytic applications teams to identify data capture needs and tag the critical elements in the digital experience.Proven ability to synthesize and summarize findings using data from multiple sources including digital analytics, voice of the customer, user research, identify key insights and opportunities, and work with product managers and designers to improve user experiences.Act as a data SME for Cloud product and customer data, facilitate cross data support & drive partnership across analytics teams across the organization.Take the first step towards your dream careerEvery Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:Essential RequirementsBachelor's or Master's Degree10 to 15 years work experience in digital analytics, customer insights or a related fieldStrengths in structured and logical thinking, problem solving, issue resolution, and attention to detail with the ability to manage ambiguity if new and unique areasExceptional analytical skills - ability to generate insight from complex analytics and make digestible to the massesDemonstrated strength in leading strategic analysis and/or digital analytics and voice of the customerDemonstrated strength in digital optimization on websites, mobiles devices and digital marketing vehiclesExpertise with at least one data/analysis programming language (SQL /R/Python)Desirable RequirementsEntrepreneurial, creative thinker who can work across multiple domainsFamiliarity with or ability to learn technical product concepts related to compute, storage, networking and converged, hyper-converged infrastructure technologiesHere’s our story; now tell us yoursDell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.Application closing date: DD Month YYYYDell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.
